Description: Shoulder sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery hydria; exterior: added red band on moulded junction of shoulder and neck; below, black-figure decoration consisting of siren to right, with red eye, dilute earring, added white flesh and red wing with white dots; below, two black bands; below, male figure (red hair and white dotted stephane remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the siren, see British Museum 1886,0401.1113. Sirens are commonly depicted on vases from the Urla Group.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 58)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 131, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.117) (phase 3)
